title: Govt sets 3-hour deadline for social media platforms to remove flagged AI deepfakes
description: New government rules now mandate clear labelling for all AI-generated content, including deepfakes and synthetic audio, starting February 20. Social media platforms must verify user declarations on AI content and embed traceable metadata.  Takedown timelines have been drastically reduced to as little as three hours for certain violations, with platforms also required to warn users about penalties.

He argues that publicly filed patents become free training data for AI models, enabling rivals to easily develop workarounds. Cuban suggests this shift, exemplified by Elon Musk's approach, will become increasingly common in the AI age.

title: Stefon Diggs hotel rumour fuels breakup talk with Cardi B
description: Rumors are swirling around Cardi B and Stefon Diggs after fans noticed they unfollowed each other following the Super Bowl. Speculation intensified when Cardi left the event early and reports surfaced alleging Diggs was seen with another woman in a hotel room hours after the loss. Neither has confirmed a breakup, but online chatter continues to grow.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.
